title: Why Parents Clash With Schools Over Books
sub_head: Are they pushing back against politicization or stifling different voices?
body:
Most parents pushing back against the politicization of our schools welcome diverse authors, characters and stories. They object to graphic sex, whether it is heterosexual or homosexual, and to demeaning stereotypes, whether they are Hispanic, black or Christian (“Texas District Spars Over Bid to Remove Books,” U.S. News, July 1). Parents simply want school leaders to refocus on providing our children with a solid educational foundation that exposes them to true diversity of experience, culture and thought.
Laurie Defield
